column5: ....I'm heading up to Simcoe in the wee hours of the morning and was wondering if access is available into the park and launch area or is it gated? If I recall you need loonies to pay for the lauch, is that correct?

Chris,first of all have a great time.2nd of all,the launch is large enough for that HUGE tiller you got. I never seen any gates closed there,but being the long weekend,Im sure the guards of the park will be there. I do believe the launch is 10 paso,s. HAVE A GREAT TIME.
Sibbald Point Provincial Park calling the park directly at (905) 722-8061. Hope that helps Spiel
Coin gate. Pay for park access. Open all year. I don't remember a launch fee tho......Good luck Dude. Perchin or whities?
And the gate also takes C.Cards.....
....Thanks for the help guys, I think I got it. A pocket full of coins to get me in and a lake full of fish, should be, could be good. I'll be after whities and then hopefully find some perch TEP.
Better take 11.5 loonies with you! Heard tonite launching fees at the park went from 7 dollars to 11.50. Unreal eh!

why not try launching from cooks bay...free public launch with plenty of parking.....off of leslie near miami dr i think....take lake road sounth to the bend....decent launch......  all the best and have fun
I was there last weekend and it is $11.50.
